intro: Eriogonum minus, commonly known as the small globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as sagebrush steppe and coastal dunes. The plant features hairy, glandular stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eriogonum minus is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
